post.title: ARNEIS project journal - dev-cw03
post.content:
Welcome to our weekly status report of the ARNEIS project!

As I announced in a previous post

Your team “B-AROL-O Bottling Systems” and project “ARNEIS: Automated Recognizer, Network-Enabled, Items Sorter” have been selected as one of just 50 teams to move on to Phase 2 of OpenCV Spatial AI Contest. Your team name and region are listed on the official webpage at https://opencv.org/opencv-spatial-ai-contest/​

Here is the report of our progress in the ARNEIS project after the end of CW03-2022.

What did we accomplish this week?

In Sprint dev-cw03 we closed 24 issues and/or Pull Requests

TODO: Add screenshot of https://github.com/orgs/B-AROL-O/projects/1/views/5

Let's highlight the most significant ones.

Enhancements to the B-AROL-O logo

Pietro d'Agostino, the author of the first non-core team member contribution which we spoke about last week, did not rest on his laurels and implemented the suggestions he received in [FEAT]: Enhancements to B-AROL-O logo B-AROL-O/ARNEIS#35.

The updated B-AROL-O logo is now proudly featured on our GitHub and Twitter profiles!

This week we should also write about:

  • READTHEDOCS integration [FEAT]: Configure arneis.readthedocs.io B-AROL-O/ARNEIS#29 and the discovered bugs [BUG]: Build of project ARNEIS on readthedocs.org fails B-AROL-O/ARNEIS#68 [BUG]: conf.py generated by sphinx-quickstart does not pass super-linter B-AROL-O/ARNEIS#61
  • We are trying to see if we can use 2 different OAK-D-LITE and we opened an issue to the maintainers [FEAT]: Investigate the feasibility to use 2 OAK-D-Lites at the same time B-AROL-O/ARNEIS#54
  • If you manage to merge the code, also talk about the first few lines of code: Create test_multiple_OAKD.py B-AROL-O/ARNEIS#58
  • All of the previous topics while learning about how to implement ML and train our network which we HOPE will be implemented next week

Next week plans

TODO: Add screenshot of https://github.com/orgs/B-AROL-O/projects/1/views/1
